comment.author: 96730044@N04
comment._content: I found the tonettes in the stack of boxes on the right to be interesting.  My father had a tonette in WWII.  He was in the Air Force, stationed in Persia, and talked about playing it there, especially for a young Persian boy that he befriended.  He brought the tonette home with him, and often entertained his children and grandchildren with it.  I had assumed he originally brought it to Persia from the U.S., but maybe he received it there (for "R and "R).  His tonette says High Tone Songflute on it.
